name: Tigh Na Cloich Hotel

reviews.text: Our stay at Tigh Na Cloich Hotel was a delight – it really topped off our visit to Scotland! We were met with fabulous hospitality and this was sustained throughout our whole stay. Comfy beds, extraordinary food, and divine location. Pitlochry is quaint and breathtaking. The value is exceptional.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay - Excellent Food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to Helen, Peter and James for a wonderful 3 nights during our stay in May, 2012. Welcoming, helpful, gracious are but a few words to describe our host and hostess and their delightful son. We were sorry to leave. Our room was lovely (number 4) with a view ourlooking the town and mountains. A scottish breakfast was included and it was wonderful. We ate dinner at the B&B the first night for convenience. The food was so good we decided to eat there all three nights. Great location! Would return in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Stayed 3 nights, could have stayed a week

reviews.text: Al and Lucy, New York, USA
reviews.title: What a Find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled on this charming B&B by accident because of an online overbooking at another B&B. nearby. What a stroke of good luck. Excellently run by a charming host and hostess, who are accommodating to our needs. Breakfast is fantastic and dinner even better. You cannot miss by staying here.
reviews.title: Lovely stay, shame we only could stay one night

reviews.text: Stayed for one night in the Tigh Na Cloich in June 2012. Had a lovely stay, our room was light and airy with a wonderful view of the mountains. Ideally situated in Pitlochry and within easy walking distance of everything, including the fish ladder. We stayed on a DB&B basis and weren't disappointed, the food was delicious. Would definitely recommend this hotel and if ever up that way again would certainly go back.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night in room number 7 which was on the top floor. The room was large and very comfortable. The views over Pitlochry and the surrounding countryside were amazing. It was a short walk down through the garden of the hotel to the main street. Breakfast was nice and I think if I stayed here again I would eat dinner in the hotel too!
reviews.title: A warm welcome and wonderful views

reviews.text: We didn't want to go after two wonderful days at this hotel. We had a wonderful view from our room (nr 4). The food in the restaurant was one of the highlights for us. So tasty and fresh. This hotel and his staff is superb!! We look forward to our next visit!
reviews.title: Superb!
Nice room, good food & drink
reviews.text: Very pleasant stopover from Inverness to Edinburgh. Clean and quiet room with a front view. Easy walk to the main street. Good breakfast. They cooked my eggs just right! In the evening we were able to get a glass off wine & whisky (you're in Scotland)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very enjoyable stay clean and friendly with lovely views.We dined in hotel for evening meal and the food was lovely with a good selection and very well presented and breakfast was of equal standard,will definitely pay another visit.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hosts, scrupulously clean, beautifully decorated. Great location very close to the town centre but above it.
reviews.title: Perfect break on our way north
Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel. We had room 7 (attic room). Watch your head going up, but once you are there wow was it worth it. Large spotless Room with a gorgeous view. Only there for one night. Had breakfast and dinner, both beautiful. We were able to walk into town in a minute. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When visiting the Pitlochry Festival Theatre we make a point of booking in here for dinner bed & breakfast for a few nights because we always get a warm welcome from Helen & Peter, the rooms are very clean & comfortable, and the food is superb. The hotel is in an excellent location for the town and the theatre. We thoroughly recommend it.
reviews.title: Tom & Myra

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights with my elderly mother. The hotel was spotless and the room was spacious. View from room 7 was great, although we had to use stairs as there is no lift. I am a coeliac (can't eat gluten) so sometimes I end up only having salad and steak in hotels, but the range and quality of food on offer was excellent, and I had a choice for each course. I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Very accommodating staff and great food

reviews.text: I've just returned from Scotland and my stay at Tigh was definitely one of the highlights. My family and I felt welcome as soon as we arrived. Helen was very helpful and friendly, and she ensured that we were all comfortably settled in. The views from the windows were breathtaking, even in cloudy weather! I would say that my overall impression of this lovely place is that of a cozy cottage. Next time I will book for 3 nights!
reviews.title: Cozy Cottage

reviews.text: Alison, Ontario, CANADA
reviews.title: All-around awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stumbled across this Hotel, having arrived on a very busy weekend in Pitlochry. We were only there to spend one night if I had know the Hotel and place was so great we would have stayed for a few more days. I cant praise this place enough! The location just up the hill behind the main street means it quiet. A warm friendly welcome. The room are immaculate and has everything you need. The breakfast was fantastic and a highlight for me a VEGETARIAN option, home made apricot,nut and spinach (if I remember right) sausage was delicious. I would Highly recommend this Hotel and look forward to returning!
reviews.title: Perfect! and Vegetarian Friendly :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at this lovely guest house. Ideally located a 1 min walk downhill to the main street of Pitlochry where there is an abundance of pubs and restaurants. On arrival we were made very welcome by the owner and shown to our room which was large, bright and modern with wonderful views. First evening we had dinner in the dining room which is not to be missed and excellent value at £18 each for 2 courses - the quality of the food was top notch. Rump steak in a gorgeous dijon mustard sauce, sea bream with capers for my other half then whisky bread and butter pudding for afters. Beautifully seasoned and lovely fresh tasty veg. So glad we chose to stay and I'm sure we'll be back in the autumn for another couple of days of relaxation in a wonderful location. Don't be put off that there isn't a hotel bar as you really don't need one as the local pubs are on your doorstep.
reviews.title: So glad we stayed for dinner too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Granted, we were married 10 years ago, but our stay at Tigh Na Cloich was a highlight of this summer's vacation together. The view was stunning, the room was beautiful, and the service felt very personal. The hotel is set just up a hill, which makes it feel like a cozy retreat, but you just have to walk down the garden path to be in the center of town.
reviews.title: Great for a honeymoon!

reviews.text: There were 5 in our group and we only stayed 1 night but it was very lovely. They made us all feel very welcome from the drinks in the parlor to the fabulous food! I'm not normally a fan of venison but since on vacation I thought I'd try it and it was very good. The lady of the house is so very personable and told us many stories of the surrounding area.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel,wonderful hospitality and food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would all definately return!
reviews.title: Lovely Spot

description: Tigh Na Cloich (The House of the Sentinel Stone). This lovely Victorian House is a former historic lookout point and offers some of the most stunning views in Pitlochry.Our small personnaly run hotel offers the best of Scottish hospitality, along with outstanding cuisine and a superior level of service. The perfect setting for a relaxing holiday or short break in Pitlochry Perthshire and to tour the Highlands of Scotland.
